revised_title: Kinetic Theory of Diffusion in Gases and Liquids: Diffusion and Brownian Motion
tldr: The authors explore the phenomenon of diffusion through the lens of the Brownian motion theory. They calculate the coefficient of self-diffusion in gases and provide a method to approximate the coefficient of diffusion in liquids. The study reveals the differences between self-diffusion and mutual diffusion and highlights the importance of obtaining the true local velocity distribution for a more accurate understanding of diffusion in liquids.
